AddCustomizedConfig.document: This example shows you how to add new personalized configuration
AddCustomizedConfig.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: AddCustomizedConfig
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ConfigName": "test_xxxx",
    "ConfigType": "CLB",
    "ConfigContent": "test-xxxxxxxxxx"
}
AddCustomizedConfig.title: Adding New Personalized Configuration

AssociateCustomizedConfig.document: This example shows you how to associate a configuration.
AssociateCustomizedConfig.title: Associating a Configuration

AssociateTargetGroups.title: Binding layer-7 forwarding rules to target groups

AutoRewrite.document: `lbl-lmeeyb1q` is an HTTPS:443 listener. `www.abc.com` is a domain name of a forwarding rule under this listener.
AutoRewrite.title: Automatically generating a redirection relationship

BatchDeregisterTargets.title: Unbind a Cloud Virtual Machine

BatchModifyTargetTag.title: Setting Tags

BatchModifyTargetWeight.document: For the Cloud Load Balancer instance (lb-dx98lwo0), change the weight of the bound backend service ins-19404pl5 (port 110) under forwarding rule loc-o8cnyw6c in listener lbl-4b5hnc9a to 50, and modify the weight of the bound backend service ins-19411tzv (port 80) under forwarding rule loc-8c5pdrb8 in listener lbl-20jjtaaw to 30.
BatchModifyTargetWeight.title: Modifying the Weight of Backend Services in Batches

BatchModifyTargetWeight.document: This example shows you how to modify the server weights bound to both layer-4 and layer-7 (HTTP/HTTPS) listeners under a Cloud Load Balancer at the same time.
BatchModifyTargetWeight.title: Modifying the Server Weights of Layer-4 and Layer-7 Listeners in Batches

BatchRegisterTargets.title: Binding a Cloud Host or Elastic Network Interface

CloneLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to clone a CLB instance.
CloneLoadBalancer.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CloneLoadBalancer
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-p10fcs**"
}
CloneLoadBalancer.title: Cloning a CLB instance

CreateClsLogSet.document: This example shows you how to create a logset.
CreateClsLogSet.title: Creating a Logset

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create an HTTPS listener and bind an existing certificate.
CreateListener.title: Creating an HTTPS Listener and Binding an Existing Certificate

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create a TCP listener and configure the health check settings.
CreateListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "HealthCheck": {
        "UnHealthNum": 4,
        "HealthNum": 4,
        "IntervalTime": 7,
        "TimeOut": 5,
        "HealthSwitch": 1
    },
    "Protocol": "TCP",
    "Ports": [
        7571
    ],
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0"
}
CreateListener.title: Creating a TCP Listener and Configuring the Health Check Settings

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create an HTTPS listener and bind a new certificate.
CreateListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Protocol": "HTTPS",
    "Ports": [
        7573
    ],
    "Certificate": {
        "SSLMode": "UNIDIRECTIONAL",
        "CertContent": "-----BEGINCERTIFICATE-----\\nxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\\n-----ENDCERTIFICATE-----",
        "CertName": "my-cert",
        "CertKey": "-----BEGINRSAPRIVATEKEY-----\\nxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\\n-----ENDRSAPRIVATEKEY-----"
    },
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0"
}
CreateListener.title: Creating an HTTPS Listener and Binding a New Certificate

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create a UDP listener with the default Ping health check.
CreateListener.title: Creating a UDP Listener with the Default Ping Health Check

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create two TCP listeners (respectively named lis0 and lis1) to respectively listen on ports 7569 and 7570.
CreateListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ListenerNames": [
        "lis1",
        "lis0"
    ],
    "Protocol": "TCP",
    "Ports": [
        7570,
        7569
    ],
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0"
}
CreateListener.title: Creating Two TCP Listeners (Respectively Named lis0 and lis1) to Respectively Listen on Ports 7569 and 7570

CreateListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-fd9kpk4s",
    "Ports": [
        5689
    ],
    "Protocol": "tcp",
    "RescheduleTargetZeroWeight": true,
    "RescheduleUnhealthy": true,
    "RescheduleExpandTarget": true,
    "RescheduleStartTime": 25,
    "RescheduleInterval": 50
}
CreateListener.title: Creating a Listener and Enabling Rescheduling

CreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to create a public network CLB instance in a VPC.
CreateLoadBalancer.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateLoadBalancer
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Forward": 1,
    "ProjectId": 0,
    "LoadBalancerType": "OPEN",
    "VpcId": "vpc-30xqxt9p",
    "LoadBalancerName": "test-open"
}
CreateLoadBalancer.title: Creating a Public Network CLB Instance

CreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to create a private network CLB instance in a VPC.
CreateLoadBalancer.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateLoadBalancer
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Forward": 1,
    "SubnetId": "subnet-k57djpow",
    "LoadBalancerType": "INTERNAL",
    "VpcId": "vpc-30xqxt9p",
    "LoadBalancerName": "test_internal"
}
CreateLoadBalancer.title: Creating a Private Network CLB Instance

CreateLoadBalancerSnatIps.document: This example shows you how to create a specified Number of snat IPs.
CreateLoadBalancerSnatIps.title: Adding a SnatIp

CreateLoadBalancerSnatIps.title: Assigning a snat ip and Adding a SnatIp

CreateTargetGroup.document: This example shows you how to create a target group.
CreateTargetGroup.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateTargetGroup
<Common request parameters>

{
    "VpcId": "vpc-i1cnjuhx",
    "Port": 80,
    "TargetGroupName": "czhtest"
}
CreateTargetGroup.title: Creating a Target Group

CreateTopic.document: This example shows you how to create a topic.
CreateTopic.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateTopic
<Common request parameters>

{
    "PartitionCount": 3,
    "TopicName": "clb-topic"
}
CreateTopic.title: Creating a Topic

DeleteRule.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: DeleteRule
<Common request parameters>

    "Domain": "foo.net",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-4fbxq45k",
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0"
}

Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com

}

X-TC-Action: DescribeLoadBalancers

    "BackendPrivateIps": [
        "172.26.0.11"
    ],
    "WithRs": "1"
}

DescribeLoadBalancersDetail.title: Querying CLB Instance Details

DescribeResources.document: This example shows you how to query the list of supported availability zones and resources in the current region for users.
DescribeResources.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: DescribeResources
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Limit": 20,
    "Offset": 0
}
DescribeResources.title: Querying the List of Supported Availability Zones and Resources in the Current Region for Users

DescribeRewrite.document: This example shows you how to query the redirection relationship by specifying the forwarding rule ID.
DescribeRewrite.title: Querying the Redirection Relationship by Specifying the Forwarding Rule ID

DescribeTargetGroupInstances.document: This example shows you how to display information on servers bound to a target group.
DescribeTargetGroupInstances.title: Displaying Information on Servers Bound to a Target Group

DescribeTargetGroupList.document: This example shows you how to query the list of target groups.
DescribeTargetGroupList.title: Querying the list of target groups

DescribeTargetGroups.document: This example shows you how to query a target group by ID.
DescribeTargetGroups.title: Querying a Target Group by ID

DescribeTargetGroups.document: This example shows you how to query target group information by criteria.
DescribeTargetGroups.title: Querying Target Group Information by Criteria

DescribeTargetHealth.title: Querying the Health Status of Backend Servers in a Load Balancing Instance

DescribeTargets.document: This example shows you how to query the server list under a specific rule through filtering by location-id when the Layer-7 listener of CLB has too many rules.
DescribeTargets.title: Querying the Real Server List by Location

DescribeTargets.document: This example shows you how to query all real servers bound to a CLB instance.
DescribeTargets.title: Querying All Real Servers Bound to a CLB Instance

DescribeTaskStatus.document: This example shows you how to query whether an async task is successfully executed if the call to the forwarding rule creating API is returned successfully and the returned `RequestId` is `55c85074-3e7f-4c6d-864f-673660d4f8de`. The `Status` value of 0 in the response indicates that the task succeeded.
DescribeTaskStatus.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: DescribeTaskStatus
<Common request parameters>

{
    "TaskId": "55c85074-3e7f-4c6d-864f-673660d4f8de"
}
DescribeTaskStatus.title: Querying the status of an async task

DisassociateCustomizedConfig.document: This example shows you how to unbind a configuration.
DisassociateCustomizedConfig.title: Unbinding a Configuration

InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the price for creating a prepaid CLB instance.
InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Price for Creating a Prepaid CLB Instance

InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the price for creating a pay-as-you-go CLB instance in the pay-as-you-go network billing mode.
InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Price for Creating a Pay-as-You-Go CLB Instance in the Pay-as-You-Go Network Billing Mode

InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the price for creating a pay-as-you-go CLB instance in the network billing mode by bandwidth package.
InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Price for Creating a Pay-as-You-Go CLB Instance in the Network Billing Mode by Bandwidth Package

InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the price for creating a pay-as-you-go CLB instance in the network billing mode by bandwidth.
InquiryPriceCreateLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Price for Creating a Pay-as-You-Go CLB Instance in the Network Billing Mode by Bandwidth

InquiryPriceModifyLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the cost of modifying bandwidth for Cloud Load Balancer.
InquiryPriceModifyLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Cost of Modifying Bandwidth for Cloud Load Balancer

InquiryPriceRefundLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to request a refund quote for Cloud Load Balancer.
InquiryPriceRefundLoadBalancer.title: Requesting a Refund Quote for Cloud Load Balancer

InquiryPriceRenewLoadBalancer.document: This example shows you how to query the renewal price for a certain prepaid CLB instance.
InquiryPriceRenewLoadBalancer.title: Querying the Renewal Price of a Certain Prepaid Cloud Load Balancer

ModifyBlockIPList.document: This example shows you how to add a blocklist. You should specify the header field containing the real client IP address and enable the blocklist feature. Then you can add a blocklist. You can delete or clear the blocklist in a similar way.
ModifyBlockIPList.title: Adding a Blocklist

ModifyBlockIPList.document: This example shows you how to use the blocklist feature. You should configure the header first to specify the header field containing the real client IP address, and then enable the blocklist feature.
ModifyBlockIPList.title: Configuring the Header and Enabling the Blocklist Feature

ModifyDomain.title: Modifying the domain name of a forwarding rule under an HTTP listener

ModifyDomainAttributes.document: This example shows you how to modify the domain name attributes of a layer-7 listener.
ModifyDomainAttributes.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ModifyDomainAttributes
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Domain": "foo.net",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-n8mb2r3a",
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-1wvl0ejw"
}
ModifyDomainAttributes.title: Modifying the domain name attributes of a layer-7 listener

ModifyFunctionTargets.title: Modifying the Cloud Function Bound to the Cloud Load Balancer Forwarding Rule

ModifyListener.document: This example shows you how to modify the certificate bound to an HTTPS listener.
ModifyListener.title: Modifying the Certificate Bound to an HTTPS Listener

ModifyListener.document: This example shows you how to modify the name, health check parameters, and forwarding policy of a TCP listener.
ModifyListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ModifyListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "HealthCheck": {
        "UnHealthNum": 5,
        "HealthNum": 5,
        "IntervalTime": 60,
        "TimeOut": 35,
        "HealthSwitch": 1
    },
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-d1ubsydq",
    "ListenerName": "newlis",
    "Scheduler": "LEAST_CONN",
    "SessionExpireTime": 120
}
ModifyListener.title: Modifying the Name, Health Check Parameters, and Forwarding Policy of a TCP Listener

ModifyListener.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ModifyListener
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-fd9kpk4s",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-1sf4yxie",
    "RescheduleTargetZeroWeight": false,
    "RescheduleUnhealthy": false,
    "RescheduleExpandTarget": false,
    "RescheduleStartTime": 0,
    "RescheduleInterval": 0
}
ModifyListener.title: Modifying Listener Reschedule Parameters

ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerName": "newlbname",
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-6efswuxa"
}
ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes.title: Renaming a CLB instance

ModifyLoadBalancerSla.document: This example shows you how to upgrade a pay-as-you-go shared instance to a performance and capacity instance, or adjust the specification of an LCU-supported instance, with the SlaType customized as needed to determine the final instance specification.
ModifyLoadBalancerSla.title: Instance Specification Adjustment

ModifyRule.document: Modifies the health check parameter and forwarding policy of a forwarding rule
ModifyRule.title: Modifying the health check parameter and forwarding policy of a forwarding rule

ModifyTargetGroupAttribute.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ModifyTargetGroupAttribute
<Common request parameters>

{
    "TargetGroupId": "lbtg-815iz538",
    "TargetGroupName": "xxxxholic"
}
ModifyTargetGroupAttribute.title: Renaming a target group

ModifyTargetGroupInstancesPort.title: Batch Modifying the Port of Servers

ModifyTargetGroupInstancesWeight.title: Modifying the Server Weight of Target Groups in Batches

ModifyTargetPort.document: This example shows you how to change the port of Cloud Virtual Machine ins-dm4xtz0i bound to listener lbl-d1ubsydq from the original 233 to 334.
ModifyTargetPort.title: Modifying the Port of the Bound Backend Service

ModifyTargetWeight.document: This example shows you how to change the weight of the real server `ins-dm4xtz0i` (bound port: 334) bound to the listener `lbl-d1ubsydq` to 8.
ModifyTargetWeight.title: Modifying the weight of the real server bound to a layer-4 listener

RegisterFunctionTargets.document: This example shows you how to bind a cloud function to the layer-7 forwarding rule of a load balancing instance.
RegisterFunctionTargets.title: Binding a Cloud Function to a Forwarding Rule

RegisterTargets.title: Registering CVM to a TCP Listener

RegisterTargets.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: RegisterTargets
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-d1ubsydq",
    "LocationId": "loc-r2q3jd4c",
    "Targets": [
        {
            "InstanceId": "ins-dm4xtz0i",
            "Port": 233,
            "Weight": 10
        }
    ]
}
RegisterTargets.title: Registering CVM to the Forwarding Rule of an HTTP Listener (with the Rule Specified by LocationId)

RegisterTargets.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: RegisterTargets
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-cuxw2rm0",
    "ListenerId": "lbl-d1ubsydq",
    "Domain": "foo.net",
    "Url": "/bar8",
    "Targets": [
        {
            "InstanceId": "ins-dm4xtz0i",
            "Port": 233,
            "Weight": 10
        }
    ]
}
RegisterTargets.title: Registering CVM to the Forwarding Rule of an HTTP Listener (with the Rule Specified by Domain and Url)

RegisterTargetsWithClassicalLB.title: Binding a real server to a classic CLB instance

ReplaceCertForLoadBalancers.document: This example shows you how to replace a server certificate by specifying a new certificate ID.
ReplaceCertForLoadBalancers.title: Replacing the server certificate associated with a CLB instance

SetCustomizedConfigForLoadBalancer.title: Creating custom configurations at the CLB instance level

SetLoadBalancerClsLog.document: This example shows you how to delete Cloud Log Service (CLS) topics of a CLB instance.
SetLoadBalancerClsLog.title: Deleting CLS Topics

SetLoadBalancerClsLog.document: This example shows you how to add or modify CLS topics of a CLB instance.
SetLoadBalancerClsLog.title: Setting CLS Topics

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: This example shows you how to unbind all security groups from a CLB instance which has been bound to multiple security groups.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Unbinding All Security Groups

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: This example shows you how to unbind the security group sg-12345678 from a CLB instance which has been bound to two security groups sg-0936o7sd and sg-12345678.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Unbinding a Security Group from a CLB Instance

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: This example shows you how to bind the security groups sg-0936o7sd and sg-12345678 to a CLB instance which has not been bound to any security groups.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Binding Multiple Security Groups to a CLB Instance

SetLoadBalancerStartStatus.document: This example shows you how to enable or disable a CLB instance.
SetLoadBalancerStartStatus.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: clb.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: SetLoadBalancerStartStatus
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LoadBalancerId": "lb-hwdt33e0",
    "OperationType": "Stop"
}
SetLoadBalancerStartStatus.title: Enabling or Disabling a CLB Instance

SetSecurityGroupForLoadbalancers.title: Binding a security group to multiple CLB instances
